body.p: The Board noted that recognition and measurement requirements allow for only a partial reflection of the economic hedging activities in the financial statements, which results in a limitation of an entity’s reporting of its hedging activities. Hence, the Board considered that the transparency of an entity’s hedging activities could be enhanced by an approach that considers:

li.p: information that provides a clear picture of those risk management activities of an entity that are captured by hedge accounting (this information is not necessarily provided in the primary financial statements); and
information that is included in the primary financial statements.
